snippet: After the Nigeria Army reported reaching a cease-fire with the militant Islamist group Boko Haram two weeks ago, its leader Friday denied any truce had been reached.
abstract: News analysis; it should come as a surprise to no one that after Nigerian Army reported reaching cease-fire with militant Islamist group Boko Haram, militant group's leader, Abubakar Shekau, denies any such truce; since announcement, attacks and abductions have continued, with at least 60 young women reportedly kidnapped by militants in Adamawa State, just south of Boko Haram stronghold.
lead_paragraph: After the Nigeria Army reported reaching a cease-fire with the militant Islamist group Boko Haram two weeks ago, its leader Friday denied any truce had been reached.

headline.main: In Nigeria, Fragile Hopes of Boko Haram Freeing Schoolgirls Are Dashed
headline.print_headline: In Nigeria, Fragile Hopes of Boko Haram Freeing Schoolgirls Are Dashed
